Groups.Group: Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 6
Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 7

Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk devtoolset-3-binutils
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: new packages: devtoolset-3-binutils
Vulnerability.Description:
New devtoolset-3-binutils packages are now available as part of Red Hat Developer Toolset 3.0 for Red Hat Enterprise Linux. Binutils is a collection of binary utilities, including ar (for creating, modifying, and extracting from archives), as (a family of GNU assemblers), gprof (for displaying call graph profile data), ld (the GNU linker), nm (for listing symbols from object files), objcopy (for copying and translating object files), objdump (for displaying information from object files), ranlib (for generating an index for the contents of an archive), readelf (for displaying detailed information about binary files), size (for listing the section sizes of an object or archive file), strings (for listing printable strings from files), strip (for discarding symbols), and addr2line (for converting addresses to file and line). The devtoolset-3-binutils packages provide the Red Hat Developer Toolset version of binutils.
This enhancement update adds the devtoolset-3-binutils packages to Red Hat Developer Toolset 3.0 for Red Hat Enterprise Linux. These packages include binutils 2.24, which is the latest stable version of binutils. It provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the version included in Red Hat Developer Toolset 2.1, for example:
* The detection of uncompressed ".debug_str" sections has been fixed. * The decoding of abbreviations using the "DW_FORM_ref_addr" attribute has been fixed. * The objcopy utility now supports wildcards for section names in command-line options. * The 512-bit Advanced Vector Extensions (AVX-512) are now supported. * The ld.bfd linker has been configured to enable the "--sysroot" option at build time. * The ld linker has been fixed to correctly handle empty strings in the SONAME field in a DT_NEEDED record. (BZ#1096102, BZ#1080077, BZ#1117458)
All users who require devtoolset-3-binutils are advised to install these new packages.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
